hero.title: Centralized Web Analytics
hero.subtitle: A centralized, framework-agnostic remote analytics script that can be reused in any web application.

problem.title: The problem we solve
problem.description: In modern development environments, companies often maintain multiple web applications: landing pages, internal systems, SaaS products, dashboards, public portals, and experimental apps.
items: Ensuring tracking works correctly across different stacks
consequences: High operational cost for something that should be simple
problem.footer: The result is an ecosystem where Analytics ceases to be reliable, standardized, and easy to evolve.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.description: This project proposes a different approach: a single centralized implementation consumed via CDN.
solution.steps_header: Instead of implementing Analytics in each project, you:
steps: Publish the script to a CDN
Configure everything via data-* attributes and environment variables
solution.footer: Any adjustments, improvements, or fixes are made in one place and automatically applied to all projects.

use_cases.title: When it applies
use_cases.description: This project is ideal when you have multiple web apps and need standardized metrics with low maintenance effort.
use_cases.scenarios_header: Especially useful in scenarios such as:
scenarios: Internal platforms that grow over time

audience.title: Who it is for
audience.footer: It doesn't require deep Analytics knowledge and can be easily adopted by teams following frontend and DevOps best practices.

relevance.title: Why it matters
relevance.description: Analytics is a critical component for product decisions, marketing, acquisition, and usage monitoring. Poor implementation leads to inconsistent data and wrong decisions.
benefits: You facilitate future evolution (GDPR/LGPD, GTM, new providers)
relevance.footer: More than a script, this project is a foundation of frontend observability, prepared to grow with your products.

api.title: Tracking API
api.description: Use the global window.track function for custom events securely.
